# UV Filter Bulb Replacement {#sec-husb-UV_bulb}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: Properly maintain and change UV bulbs in recirculating system in 310 Pacific Hall.
-   **Procedure Type**: Husbandry
-   **Species**:
    -   Threespine stickleback, (*Gasterosteus aculeatus*)
    -   Gulf pipefish (*Syngnathus scovelli*)
-   **Author**: xxx
-   **Date Created**: xxx


## Materials

-   New UV bulbs
-   Stickleback system -- 120 Watt
-   Pipefish system -- 40 Watt
-   Gloves
-   High vacuum grease
-   Replacement Seals
-   Cloth for cleaning bulb housing
-   Bucket

## Solutions

- NA

## Procedure

::: {.callout-warning title="NOTES"}
- Always wear gloves when handling UV bulbs as oils from your hands can ruin the bulb.
- If bulb is not on it is probably because the prongs are incorrect.
- Take bulb back out and change the way the bulb is plugged in.
- Bulbs should be replaced once per year.
:::

1.  Turn off power to UV filter by unplugging power cord
2.  Remove bulb by unscrewing plastic bulb bolt (grey threaded bolt at
    end of filter).
3.  Unplug bulb noting prong placement.
4.  Plug in new bulb with same prong placement as old bulb.
5.  Screw in bolt and UV.
6.  Turn power back on by plugging filter back in.
7.  Check to see that UV is working by looking for light through
    "viewing window" at the end of the filter.
8.  Update changed/next change needed sticker on outside of unit.
